title: Pane resize handle feels too small Linux, Electron fails to update mouse cursor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
On vscode v1.28.2 (and presumably other versions) there is a very small region to "grab" a pane separate in order to resize the pane (e.g. make integrated terminal smaller, etc). This can make resizing panes very difficult.
[resize handle is hard to grab.mkv.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/2536045/resize.handle.is.hard.to.grab.mkv.zip)

title: Expose electron version to extension host process
body:
As discussed in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/434 extension should be able to read `electron` version, vscode bundled with.

- VSCode Version: 1.29.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write/generate simple extension 
2. In `activate` hook inspect `process.versions`
```javascript
console.log("process.versions", process.versions);
```
giving this:
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1340183/47665859-ccb2e700-dbaa-11e8-8070-012a3ffa6aec.png)

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A

title: Breadcrumb missing on read-only documents supplied by debug adapter
body: Issue Type: Bug VS Code version: Code 1.28.2 (7f3ce96ff4729c91352ae6def877e59c561f4850, 2018-10-17T00:23:51.859Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063 1. Start debugging something. In my case I am debugging a debug extension written in Typescript, e.g. the mock-debug sample. 2. Use the Pause button to suspend execution at a point where the debug adapter will supply the (read-only) source for display. In my case it was easy to suspend in async_hooks.js. 3. Observe that there's no breadcrumb on the loaded document. Toggling breadcrumb on the View menu has no effect. 4. Set a breakpoint in a source that exists on the local filesystem. Run to that breakpoint and confirm that a breadcrumb appears as expected. Toggling breadcrumb on the View menu works as expected. Also occurs on current 1.29 Insider. I don't recall if the same problem existed in other breadcrumb-enabled versions (i.e. 1.26+).

title: Surface the 'origin and 'presentationHint' attributes of a Source in the Loaded Scripts Explorer

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
When a Source appears in the CALL STACK panel during debugging, its `presentationHint` modifies the row's appearance, and its `origin` displays on the second line of the hover tip.

Please apply `presentationHint` in the same way on the LOADED SCRIPTS panel.

Please also surface `origin` there, either by appending in italics (as currently happens in the OPEN EDITORS panel) or as a second line of the hover tip.

title: Parsing arguments passed to debug providers
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.25.2
- OS Version: 10.13.5

We can pass custom arguments in our debug providers' configurations, e.g.:

```javascript
args: [`--extensionDevelopmentPath=${rootPath}`]
```

For some reason the following isn't properly parsed:

```javascript
args: [`--extensionDevelopmentPath="${rootPath}"`]
args: [`--extensionDevelopmentPath='${rootPath}'`]
```

Notice that I'm quoting the value of the `extensionDevelopmentPath` option.

Is this documented anywhere? Is this a bug?

title: Tree API: When using async `getChildren` of TreeDataProvider, no progress on revealing
Tree API bug for overlapping ranges

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Testing #62073

Overlapping causes TreeItems to have wrong labels.

Try either of these two:

```ts
		label: <vscode.TreeItemLabel>{ label: key, highlights: key.length > 1 ? [[0, 2], [1, 3]] : void 0},

		label: <vscode.TreeItemLabel>{ label: key, highlights: key.length > 1 ? [[0, 3], [1, 2]] : void 0},
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/47753393-9d58b480-dc54-11e8-9d2a-6b98763083ae.png)

body: Issue Type: Feature Request Assign colors or labels to any folder, making it easy to identify the most important. Useful for when working with many folders.

title: Terminal: add a way of getting the exit code
body:
It would be great if each terminal object had an `exitCode` property that will resolve to the actual exit code of the process. Something like this:

```typescript
Terminal {
  exitCode: Thenable<number> 
}
```

It would be especially useful when running commands in the terminal dynamically from extensions, this way we could easily detect when the terminal exited and if it the command exited without errors.

title: User needs to be able to control whether or not the issue report seaches duplicates
body: Issue Type: Bug We introduced several settings that allow users to control whether or when VS Code talks to online services. They show when searching for `@tag:usesOnlineServices` in the settings editor. There is no way to control online service usage for the issue reporter. Neither a checkbox on the issue reporter nor a setting. There should be one since we don't talk to GH directly. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.29.0-insider (4626bc0e1b679d555dd6f034ece35ffc394b3bb7, 2018-10-29T06:11:45.152Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.0.0

title: [Usability]A11y_PowerShellEditorServices_Terminal_Usability : After spiliting Terminal panel, When we move to next split terminal Screenreader does not read any instuction.
body:
Environment Details:
VSCode Version : 1.28.2
OS Version : Win10

Additional information : Usability issue 

Repro Steps:
1.Launch Visual Studio code desktop application.
2.Navigate to "View" item of menu bar and select "Integrated Terminal"->Navigate to "Terminal" tab and select "PowerShell Integrated Console" from combo box.
3.Navigate "Terminal panel" -->Navigate to "Split terminal button" & split terminal into 2,3 screens.
4.Start NVDA & check whether it is reading proper instruction or not.
 
Actual:
After Splitting Terminal panel, When we move to next split terminal Screenreader does not read any instruction that at which terminal we are currently present.
 
Expected:
After Splitting Terminal panel, When we move to next split terminal Screenreader should read the instruction that at which terminal we are currently present.
 
User Impact:
Screen reader users finds difficult to understand the functionality as well unable to identify at which terminal panel he/she editing.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Attachment:
[A11y_PowerShellEditorServices_Terminal_Usability1.pptx](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/2524921/A11y_PowerShellEditorServices_Terminal_Usability1.pptx)

title: editor.selectionHighlight causing confusing highlighting noise when searching
body:
Issue Type: Bug I'm using the search panel to search for text across an entire workspace. I have case sensitivty and whole word matching enabled. When I move selection through the results in the panel it opens the file containing the result for previewing. Because this selects the text of the current match, editor.selectionHighlight kicks in and highlights all the occurrances of the same text in the file. This doesn't respect the case sensitivity and whole word settings and ends up adding a ton of visual noise within the newly opened editor. I'm reasonably certain this has not always happened and is a bug introduced recently. Also, this behavior does not match what happens when searching within a single editor, where spurious highlighting never occurs. Ideally, selectionHighlight is disabled while the search panel is open. Or at the very least respects search settings so it isn't destroying the user's ability to see actual search results. Expected (selectionHighlight disabled): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/484784/47630179-9a4ab080-dafc-11e8-9a3a-defeb244416a.png) Actual (selectionHighlight enabled): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/484784/47630182-9e76ce00-dafc-11e8-9feb-e63f06f2f2d4.png) VS Code version: Code 1.28.2 (7f3ce96ff4729c91352ae6def877e59c561f4850, 2018-10-17T00:23:51.859Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: Predominant axis scrolling
body:
It would be nice if there was an option to scroll only the predominant axis.
This is a standard feature of NSScrollView on macOS.
UX-wise you usually scroll vertically but of course on a trackpad deltaX will not be exactly zero, so it happens quite easily that the leftmost characters get clipped.

With predominant axis scrolling only the bigger delta gets applied, and mostly vertical scrolling is strictly just vertical without any stray x-position change.

title: Strip trailing whitespace after the cursor when pressing enter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
When pressing the enter key, I'd like VSCode's automatic indentation to remove any whitespace directly after the insertion point, so that whatever was after the insertion point on that line ends up correctly indented. Currently, anything after the insertion point is untouched, so the line is not correctly indented and I have to manually delete that extra whitespace.

For example, I often have a situation where my cursor is in a line like this:

![indent1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/578731/47612472-754d3380-da51-11e8-9b36-5b549874f801.png)

With automatic indentation enabled in VSCode, pressing the enter key results in this:

![indent2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/578731/47612486-a88fc280-da51-11e8-86cf-76c372dae7d8.png)

But that whitespace after the cursor is still there, so the indentation isn't actually correct. Other editors I've used (even Visual Studio, if I recall correctly) would give this result instead:

![indent3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/578731/47612474-754d3380-da51-11e8-8fc1-796ea4454aab.png)

title: Support adding grammars at runtime

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Hello!

I'm the author of [vscode-language-babel](https://github.com/michaelgmcd/vscode-language-babel) and I'd love to be able to support [configurable tagged template literal grammar extensions](https://github.com/gandm/language-babel#javascript-tagged-template-literal-grammar-extensions). In order to do this, I'd need to be able to add grammars based on the users configuration instead of in the `contributes.grammars` field.

I've noticed the [vscode-textmate](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-textmate) library used within vscode has the methods I would need but they don't seem to be public. Would a feature like this be possible to expose to extension authors?

title: Select all current active indent keyboard shortcut
body:
A keyboard shortcut for selecting everyting in the current active indent, could be useful for selecting a React or html component for example.

Basically, it would be to select everything that has an indentation of at least same or more as the highlighted indent guide as shown below in two pictures.

When cursor and highlighted indent guide are like below:

![screen shot 2018-10-26 at 17 19 22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33025255/47603222-bf9ec800-d9f1-11e8-905a-b797194cbd65.png)

keyboard shortcut should select this:

![screen shot 2018-10-26 at 17 13 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33025255/47603228-d0e7d480-d9f1-11e8-8e09-e0c0f02b9b29.png)

I often find myself trying to select an entire React component which could be 20 lines sometimes, so it'd be pretty handy to have such shortcut.

title: snippets sub folders
body:
I would like to be able to create sub folders in my user\snippets folder, so I can organise my snippets better.

eg.

Code\User\snippets\java
Code\User\snippets\c++
Code\User\snippets\work

Currently, when I do this, my snippets in the subfolder no longer work.
